caption: First time at this restaurant. The food was delicious, the ambiance was wonderful and the service was excellent.
The food is regularly fresh and tasty, staff members hands over great service. I loved how clean it is and vibes. Worth a try.

Fabulous! Truly delicious and the atmosphere was perfect. Maria and Cono were fabulous and gave us a great feeling of friendship. The plates were fresh and done perfect. A definite go to for any size group.
It was very easy to accommodate for our large group. The place has a very comfortable and modern vibe. Food was incredible and the service was amazing. Everyone in the party loved their food
Great food and service. They are taking good covid19 precautions. Feel very comfortable here.

Awful veal scallopine, grizzle, tasted like the meat was old. Simply had to leave it uneaten. In fact, the three of us left our plates almost intact on the table. The veal with eggplant dish had hard uncooked eggplant with the same oldish tasting hard veal. We were flabbergasted. Our third guest would not eat his dish either which was pasta and a cream sauce. It was as if it came out of a can. How could it have been that bad? In Brooklyn! PS: I thought the cooks wear masks. I looked in and none did. Why did this place get such a high rating?  We simply left some cash on the table and left. The food was practically untouched. The waiter didn’t even say he was sorry but protested that he eats it all the time. Quite disappointed with this so-called restaurant.
We had such a pleasant lunch at La Locanda. Everything from food to service makes you feel “a casa”. Now one of my favorite Italian place in the city.

My favorite neighborhood spot! Everyone that works here make you feel like family. Has that old school feeling but in the best way possible, no frills just good food. Order the teggiano salad, you can never go wrong with the specials, always substitute for fresh pasta, and you must have a piece of the warm crusty bread. And it’s all reasonably priced with large portions.
The best the best the best
Family  run, the food is great service is great I love this place last of the great restaurants in the Williamsburg Brooklyn area  up there with belmonte  and frost

The main dish food and drinks were great. I had to take a couple stars off for the wait time from when we ordered our food and when we received the entree. It was quite long. Approached 45 minute wait, and the place wasn’t very crowded. Also, we ordered the cheesecake for dessert and it was basically a very small slice that had a mushy almost pudding like consistency.
The service is great and the food is amazing also there yogurt pie is to die for I highly recommend this place.

Been eating here for 20+ years. Food is always fresh and cooked to perfection. Prices for dishes are way below the normal for such quality of food and service. The food is light and tasty, the way it's supposed to be; not overly cooked with butter and salt. Family owned and  operated so you always get the best. Bringing friends and family here for years and everyone loves this place.
Very good food and Excellent service

I told my friends about this place with my highest recommendations. I visit this place often. This recommendation is always successful. The dishes they serve are delicious and the crew is efficient and cooperative. Whenever we eat in this place we enjoy a splendid time.  warmly recommended.
The staff was great, the appetizers were good, the entrees were very bland had no taste. We had chicken parmesan & filet of sole oregganato, small portion no flavor at all.
Always a great meal. They make you feel like one of the family
Very good
Unreliable kitchen. Kitchen is always closing early. Lame.
Excellent food!!
Great food, always fresh and homemade taste. Very authentic and intimate for that homestyle italian dining experience.
Great food and service.  A great family restaurant. Go here and you will not be disappointed.

I go to this outstanding restaurant many times  as I love the special air that is unique to this restaurant. The crew is exceptionally loyal and qualified. The service is very rapid. Most important, the food they prepare is first-rate. I came often and I was always pleased. The price is decent. I recommend this place to my friends and family.
Awesome meal
Exceptional and flavorful food, I loved the character the spot has, and the staff members were super friendly. Will definitely visit here again.
Food, service,  atmosphere..we just loved the place.

This is a small restaurant, but has really great food and interesting menu selections. The waitstaff are friendly and helpful. The food is fresh and delicious.  This is a definite strong recommendation.
Prices were great for the large portions and friendly service. I had my dinner here and it was exactly that I ordered and it was delicious and well served!

Sadly, much of Italian Williamsburg is long gone yet somehow, this place has lingered on as some sort of punishment for those few unfortunates unlucky enough to have wandered in. If you are the sort of person who loves the chicken parm at Greek diners, perhaps this place may suit you.
No longer a choice for us.Once upon a time, the food was excellent, without exception. Now, I don't know what happened here.
Very bland Italian food. They've been in the neighborhood for a while, and probably have a lot of local customers.

Attended a surprise birthday party in the back room and it was great! The room was very private and comfortable (probably around 60 people). Everything ran very smoothly with the excellent pacing of the courses. The entire staff was very polite and accommodating.. Started with cold antipasto platter for each table consisting of sliced meats, roasted red and hot green peppers, portobello mushrooms and mozzarella and tomato. Excellent bread as well. Two pasta dishes were very good, followed by entrees (choice of chicken parmesan, baked filet of sole, or veal marsala). Everyone was very pleased with whichever dish they had. At the end, they provided a delicious assortment of Italian cookies. Very nice choice for a special party.
Good food. Good service. All round happy place to dine
Excellent food, service and atmosphere!
(Translated by Google) Excellent value for money! Council  (Original) Ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo! Consiglio

The place is unpretentious. The service is excellent. They do not rush you out. The food take a little time to come out and it's because everything on your plate is fresh. I had the linguini and clams. The clams were small but they stack them on the dish was absolutely amazing. The portion was very generous. The sauce was light and delicious. I didn't leave a pasta let alone a clam on my plate. One of the best I have had. I highly recommend this place. I came all the way from Long Island and it was definitely worth my trip.
Really great Italian, family owned/family run, locals restaurant
Good pasta and friendly staff. Great selection of wines. The gelato truffle dessert wasn't good, but they have a very long list of desserts that I would be willing to try. I'd go back there again.
Incredible homemade pasta with super tasty tiramisu. The espresso is perfectly pulled and the seafood is expertly cooked. Do not miss this spot!
Love this restaurant ~Kiara
The food is excellent, the service is superb. Nice place to take the family for dinner.

Quaint old school style restaurant with a nice back room for either a family or other type of gathering which is what I was attending. Had never been here before and was very pleasantly surprised. Clean with attentive service but not intrusive; the food was very good with ample portions very reasonably priced.  Parking in the area is a bit tight but the place is worth the effort.
Homemade pasta with veal ragu.....delicious
(Translated by Google) Authentic ~  (Original) 道地~
Awesome Food and Service!
huge portions, great price and good service.
food service very good,  price very good,
Excellent! You for delicious food and great service..

Great food. Friendly staff. Quaint cozy space. It's small but cozy. - that first sentence is what I wrote a year ago. But my visit just recently was not great. My husband was disappointed in his eggplant rollatini appetizer two little tiny rollatinis came out and for the price they charged that played should have been a lot bigger. My arugula Walnut goat cheese salad came out with not one stitch of goat cheese anywhere to be found on my salad which was $10 from the appetizer and the most expensive ingredient was nowhere to be found. For dinner I ordered the Involtini di Pollo the first piece I tried to cut was hard as  rubber. It tasted like very distinct freezer burn after taste every single bite! Lord knows how long it was sitting in a refrigerator getting more stale and they took it out and put it in the oven and put it on my plate like it was freshly made. And lastly they gave us the dessert menu and  the menu had Napoleon, when we tried to order it the waiter said, "we don't have that anymore." And I said well it's on the menu and he said, *we haven't had that dessert in a really long time here.", so I said then why didn't you take it off the menu already? Seriously, take a black Sharpie and just cross it out. I've seen restaurants do it, if you don't want to invest in reprinting a new menu. Ironically when you look at the menu online it's a tad bit different, for instance my salad shows that it's $9 and it only has arugula and walnuts, but in the actual restaurant menu showed arugula walnuts and goat cheese and it was for $10 pretty expensive for a salad especially when not one stitch of goat cheese was anywhere in my salad. So I have to say I'm very disappointed as well as my husband because he didn't enjoy his chicken cutlet Parmesan dinner either. It still has that cozy feel and the waiter was very accommodating it's just their food and their menu was a very big disappointment.
Great place, delish food, and excellent customer service.  👍
Fabulous restaurant.  Delicious pasta and sauces, reasonably priced.  The owners are warm and inviting make you feel like family.  Love this place.
Excellent food excellent prices
Home made pasta and desert.family place reasonable prices great place
Amazing Food!! You can taste that its Made with Love!! Try the Cheesecake!!
Amazing food and folk. Love this place...huge recomendation is....fresh fusili with Vodka sauce.
Had a catering event here not long ago, mediocre at best, food was fair, service not existent. We were expecting more based on previous reviews. Not recommended, however the espresso coffee was good
Amazing food, amazing wine. Highly recommend!
Upscale Italian food cooked to perfection at midrange pricing.
very good service food was excellent I felt like I was at my family's house 10 plus
Good place to eat.
The BEST
Very friendly, good value, tasty food
The food wasn't great

My husband and I are new in town and were looking for a special place to celebrate our anniversary. We came across with "La Locanda", gave it a try and I just have to say it was the BEST decission. The evening was AMAZING, we loved everything. Nice, cozy place, with EXCELLENT food and service. This will definitely be our new favorite restaurant... HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!

I don’t know how all the other reviews are raving about this place.  The staff and atmosphere are the best part; the food, not so much. Our wine was sour, the chicken tasted old, the penne al vodka was bland, and the salad was extremely vinegary.
Amazing food. Amazing ambiance. Owner's and staff seems like family and are inviting you to be part of it. Did I say...amazing food? AMAZING.
Great food, good service, reasonable prices. A little neighborhood gem.
10 out of 10 Old world.. Amazing service Food unbelievably great Feels like home.  Meet vist again and again  Best fried calimari I have ever had....  You will be sorry if you don't stop by

I have been coming for years and food is always good. My daughter loves the baked ziti. But my favorite is the owners" homemade cheesecake which is out of this world! It is as fluffy and light as a cloud looks and not too sweet. She never makes enough and only has it on Fridays and maybe Saturdays. Make more!!

left brooklyn 50 years ago. came back for Aunts funeral we had dinner here.... wow what food and service. owners treated us like family and the co owner ( wife) was amazing. Served 25 of us alone. She was like 4 people never saw one person do so much so quick and perfectly. Sorry I live so far away or that would be me and my wife's regular Friday night dinner spot. One of the best Italian resetrants I've ever been to
Delicious food and great service. Can't wait to come back!
cozy restaurant, i like its envoirnment, small but food are nice, nice price too, feel like in a home open kitchen
Great environment and amazing food!
home like atmosphere. great food. nice portions. fair pricing. delicious. definitely recommend.
Very good restaurante

15 dollars for penne vodka with grilled chicken hat was the size of a small side dish. (Carmine's up the street is $10, and triple the size) Pasta was over cooked. Chicken looked like scraps and tasted rubbery. The bread they gave us was basically old sliced rye bread.
Traditional family-owned Italian restaurant. They make their on pasta on the premises and the salsa is out of this world.

A hidden gem off of the Graham Ave stop with a cozy atmosphere and no music. I think they already know Italians will talk over any music anyway.  I think this is some of the best Italian food regardless of cost (although it is at a very reasonable price).  The portions are generous and the staff will make great suggestions for your taste.  I had the spinach ravioli with vodka sauce and it was absolutely delicious. It wasn't too heavy on the cream and the ravioli was cooked to perfection with a tiny bit al dente chewy to it.  It all mingled very nicely in my mouth and left me completely satisfied.  The only thing was that the wine was a little crappy. I'd suggest cracking open a bottle instead of getting the individual $5 glasses.  Call me old fashion, but you gotta have a good wine pairing with Italian food.  I will definitely be back here to try some more things on the menu. A repeated dining experience and food quality will bump this to a five-star rating. I would highly suggest dropping by if you're in the area.

Great classic Italian restaurant  that's family-owned. The food is truly old world Italian and awesome! Though pricier than some of the other Italian restaurants in the area, it's worth it for a classy evening out with your loved ones. My wife and I eat there and always leave fulfilled.
Food is flavourful.. Not your typical pasta

A family owned, authentic Italian restaurant. We popped in here after seeing good prices on the menu on the window. Little did we know we were walking into our new favorite restaurant. The atmosphere was quaint, yet we felt we were in a different place then the bustling city streets. Out came the homemade whole wheat bread that was fresh and warm. The service was so nice, as my fiance and I get into deep conversations over dinner, they service didn't linger yet our cups never hit bottom, and they took great care of us. Then, the FOOD. My fiance got the lasagna ( a true test of Italian we like to say ) and I did the Penne Alla Vodka. Homemade sauces that electrify your taste buds. Perfect. No other word.  So, I HIGHLY recommend this spot. You will not be disappointed!
A great Italian family run restaurant.
Always makes me feel like I'm eating in someone's dining room, maybe because I am!  Penne vodka is amazing. I think I like everything I've ever tried.
